html:
Midas Man, the long-in-the-works biopic of Beatles manager Brian Epstein, will be available to watch in North America from Wednesday, January 22, 2025, via Olyn.

Starring Jacob Fortune-Lloyd in the lead role, the film charts Epstein’s life as a gay, Jewish maverick who was instrumental in the Beatles’ rise before his death, of an accidental drug overdose, in 1967. Midas Man also stars Emily Watson, Eddie Marsan, Jay Leno, Suzy Eddie Izzard, and, as the Beatles, Blake Richardson (Paul McCartney), Jonah Lees (John Lennon), Leo Harvey-Elledge (George Harrison), and Campbell Wallace (Ringo Starr).

Composer Alex Baranowski’s soundtrack was released last month, upon the film’s UK streaming launch via Amazon Prime. Watch a trailer for the film below.
